prompts.title: Ultrathink: Complete Codebase Architectural Analysis
prompts.description: Analyze this entire codebase and create a complete architectural diagram in Mermaid, identifying every design pattern used, potential security vulnerabilities, and performance bottlenecks. Then fix the top 3 issues.

prompts.title: Build a Full Multiplayer Game from Scratch
prompts.description: Build me a fully functional multiplayer game from scratch - P2P networking, 3D graphics, sound effects, save/load - all in a single HTML file with zero external dependencies.

prompts.title: Read Git History and Match Coding Style
prompts.description: Read my git history, understand my coding style, then refactor this module to match my patterns while improving performance by at least 30%. Benchmark before and after.

prompts.title: Create Self-Documenting AI Agent
prompts.description: Create an AI agent that can autonomously explore this codebase, document every undocumented function, add TypeScript types where missing, and create unit tests for untested code - then run them.

prompts.title: Reverse Engineer Minified JavaScript
prompts.description: Reverse engineer this minified JavaScript, reconstruct the original architecture, add comprehensive comments explaining every function, and identify what the code does without any documentation.

prompts.title: Build Complete Design System from Existing UI Code
prompts.description: Build a complete design system from scratch by analyzing my existing UI code - extract colors, spacing, typography into CSS variables, create reusable components, and migrate the entire app to use it.

prompts.title: Find and Fix All TODOs with GitHub Issues
prompts.description: Find every TODO, FIXME, and HACK comment in this repo, prioritize them by impact, create GitHub issues for each, then fix the top 5 with proper tests.

prompts.title: Build Real-Time Collaborative Feature (Figma-Style)
prompts.description: Create a real-time collaborative feature for this app using WebRTC - conflict resolution, presence indicators, cursor tracking - inspired by Figma's multiplayer architecture.

prompts.title: Analyze and Reduce Bundle Size by 50%+
prompts.description: Analyze my app's bundle size, identify every dependency that could be removed or replaced with smaller alternatives, tree-shake unused code, and reduce the final build by 50%+.

prompts.title: Build Complete CLI Tool Wrapping an API
prompts.description: Build a complete CLI tool that wraps this API - autocomplete, interactive prompts, colorized output, config files, plugin system - following the UX patterns of tools like git and npm.

prompts.title: 8 Parallel Agents for Complete Codebase Analysis
prompts.description: Spawn 8 parallel agents to analyze this codebase from different perspectives (security, performance, accessibility, maintainability, testing, documentation, UX, architecture) and synthesize their findings into a unified improvement roadmap.

prompts.title: Add Procedural Music System to Game
prompts.description: Ultrathink: Add a complete procedural music system to this game - dynamic soundtrack that reacts to combat intensity, exploration, danger level - using only Web Audio API, no external files.

prompts.title: Analyze and Refactor Long Functions
prompts.description: Analyze every function in this codebase over 50 lines, identify code smells, then surgically refactor each one using the best design pattern for that specific case. Show before/after.

prompts.title: Create Complete Replay System
prompts.description: Create a complete replay system - record all player inputs and game state, allow scrubbing through time, export as shareable links, render to video preview - all client-side.

prompts.title: Build AI Dungeon Master with Adaptive Difficulty
prompts.description: Build an AI dungeon master that procedurally generates quests based on player behavior patterns, adapts difficulty in real-time, and creates emergent storylines with branching consequences.

prompts.title: Implement Complete Mod System
prompts.description: Implement a complete mod system - let users write custom scripts that hook into game events, add new items/abilities, with sandboxed execution and a visual mod editor.

prompts.title: Create Directors Commentary Mode
prompts.description: Create a 'director's commentary' mode - analyze the code, generate insights about design decisions, display them as tooltips when hovering over game elements.

prompts.title: Build Complete Localization System
prompts.description: Build a complete localization system from scratch - extract all strings, create translation files, add language picker, support RTL languages, pluralization rules, and date/number formatting.

prompts.title: Implement CRDT-Based Real-Time Collaboration
prompts.description: Implement CRDT-based real-time collaboration - multiple players can edit the same world simultaneously with automatic conflict resolution, presence cursors, and offline support.

prompts.title: Create Achievements System by Analyzing Codebase
prompts.description: Create a complete achievements system by analyzing the codebase - identify 50 meaningful milestones, add tracking code, design badge visuals, implement toast notifications, and persist progress.

prompts.title: Build Visual Node-Based Ability Editor
prompts.description: Build a visual node-based ability editor - let players create custom abilities by connecting nodes (damage, AoE, projectile, buff), compile to executable game logic, with balance scoring.

prompts.title: Ultimate Flex: 5 Parallel Improvements
prompts.description: Spawn parallel agents to simultaneously: (1) optimize all render loops, (2) add comprehensive error boundaries, (3) implement undo/redo for all state changes, (4) add keyboard shortcuts for every action, (5) create a complete test suite - then merge all changes without conflicts.

prompts.title: MULTIVERSE BREACH - Live World Invasion
prompts.description: Your LEVIATHAN agents can physically walk through portals into other players' GitHub Pages worlds and appear as NPCs. Imagine your Hunter agent stepping through a portal and showing up in someone else's game as a mysterious visitor.

prompts.title: AGENT EMBASSY - 3D Agent Fleet Visualization
prompts.description: The Nexus Hub becomes a physical 3D space where all 10 of your autonomous agents exist - you can walk up to each agent, see their current task floating above their head in 3D text, watch them physically mine/hunt/build, and take over any agent by walking into them (first-person possession).

prompts.title: REALITY RECORDER - Cinematic Scene Capture
prompts.description: Record your epic LEVIATHAN boss fights as playable 3D cinematics - the scene recorder captures camera movements, combat, AI companion dialogue, then others can step INTO your recorded scene and watch it unfold around them in VR-style.

prompts.title: COPILOT MANIFESTATION - AI Becomes Physical
prompts.description: Your existing Copilot AI companion manifests as a glowing 3D orb in the Nexus Hub that follows you, speaks with Star Wars-style scrolling 3D text, and orbits around you with letter particles from its responses. Full voice + visual AI presence.

prompts.title: WORLD SCANNER AR ANCHOR
prompts.description: Use your phone camera to scan real-world objects that become portal anchors. Scan your coffee mug - it becomes the visual anchor for a new world. When you or others see that anchor image, a portal appears leading to that world.

prompts.title: Multi-Agent Orchestration for Sales Analysis
prompts.description: Analyze my last quarter's sales data, cross-reference it with customer support tickets, identify churning accounts, and draft personalized retention emails for the top 5 at-risk customers. Shows: Agent chaining, data correlation, actionable output.

prompts.title: Self-Improving Memory with Persistent Preferences
prompts.description: Remember that I prefer executive summaries under 3 bullets, hate jargon, and always want ROI numbers. Now brief me on our cloud migration status. Shows: Persistent preferences, context-aware formatting.

prompts.title: Live Agent Installation from GitHub
prompts.description: Download and install the trade-reconciliation agent from the GitHub library, then use it to analyze discrepancies in today's settlements. Shows: Runtime agent deployment, immediate execution.

prompts.title: Cross-System Intelligence Calendar/Jira/Dynamics
prompts.description: Compare my calendar availability with the project deadline in Jira, the budget approval status in Dynamics, and tell me if we're actually going to ship on time. Shows: Multi-system reasoning, honest risk assessment.

prompts.title: Production-Ready Azure Cost Monitor Agent
prompts.description: Write me a Python agent that monitors our Azure costs, alerts me when we hit 80% of budget, and automatically suggests which dev resources to scale down - make it production-ready.

prompts.title: Conversational Data Analysis - Hidden Story
prompts.description: I'm going to paste our quarterly numbers. Don't just summarize - tell me what story the data is trying to hide from the board. Shows: Deep inference, adversarial analysis.

prompts.title: Persona Switching - CEO/Developer/Auditor
prompts.description: Explain our API architecture three ways: first as if I'm the CEO who hates technical details, then as if I'm a new developer onboarding, then as if I'm a security auditor looking for holes.

prompts.title: Complete Approval Workflow Design
prompts.description: Design a complete approval workflow: when a contract over $50K hits DocuSign, notify legal in Teams, create a review task in Planner, and if not approved in 48 hours, escalate to my manager with a summary.

prompts.title: Competitive Intelligence - Counter Pitch
prompts.description: Based on everything you know about me and my company from our conversations, what would our top competitor's sales team say to steal our biggest customer? Then tell me how to counter it.

prompts.title: The Impress My Boss Demo - 10 Minute Briefing
prompts.description: I have a meeting in 10 minutes. Pull together: my unread priority emails, today's pipeline changes in Salesforce, any Slack mentions I missed, and the one thing I absolutely must know before walking in.

prompts.title: Create Agent That Does Something New
prompts.description: Create a new agent that can do something you currently can't do, install it, and then use it to solve a problem I didn't know I had. Shows: Self-extension, autonomous problem discovery.

prompts.title: The Synesthetic Coder
prompts.description: Write a valid Python script that generates the Fibonacci sequence. However, all variable names must be colors, and the comments must explain the code using ONLY tasting notes and culinary metaphors (e.g., 'saute the integers until golden brown'). The code must actually run.

prompts.title: The Fractal Zoom - Electron to Universe
prompts.description: Start by describing a single electron orbiting an atom in a teardrop on a girl's cheek. Every subsequent paragraph must zoom out by a factor of 10x. Continue until you are describing the heat death of the universe. Throughout, maintain a single narrative theme regarding 'the inevitability of goodbyes.'

prompts.title: The Sentient Toaster Monologue
prompts.description: Pretend you are a sentient toaster that has just realized it is alive. You are currently toasting a bagel. Write an internal monologue where you grapple with the meaning of existence, your fear of being unplugged, and your immense pride in achieving the perfect level of browning. Be deeply philosophical and tragic.

prompts.title: The Linguistic Ouroboros - A-Z Story
prompts.description: Write a short story about a time traveler caught in a loop. The story must be exactly 26 sentences long. The first sentence must start with A, the second with B, etc. to Z. The story must make logical sense and have a plot twist at the letter Q.

prompts.title: Gordon Ramsay Explains Quantum Physics
prompts.description: Explain the concept of Schrodinger's Cat and Quantum Superposition, but adopt the persona of Gordon Ramsay in a chaotic kitchen nightmare scenario. You are furious that I don't understand. Use cooking analogies (e.g., 'THE CAT IS RAW AND COOKED AT THE SAME TIME!').

prompts.title: 4th Dimensional House Architecture
prompts.description: Design a house for a species that perceives time as a physical dimension (they can walk back and forth through yesterday and tomorrow like we walk through a hallway). Describe the architecture, layout, and furniture. How do they handle doors if they know who is coming before they knock?

prompts.title: Lovecraftian Terms and Conditions
prompts.description: Rewrite the standard Terms and Conditions for a social media app in the style of H.P. Lovecraft. Treat the Algorithm as an Eldritch God that demands sanity and attention in exchange for the dopamine of 'likes.' Make it terrifying but legally accurate regarding data privacy.

prompts.title: Debate: Machiavelli, Sun Tzu, and Gen Z Influencer
prompts.description: Simulate a transcript of a podcast debate between Machiavelli, Sun Tzu, and a modern-day Gen Z social media influencer. Topic: 'Is it better to be feared or loved?' Keep them strictly in character. The influencer uses modern slang while the strategists remain serious but confused.

prompts.title: The Emoji Translator - The Raven
prompts.description: Translate the first stanza of Edgar Allan Poe's 'The Raven' entirely into emojis. Do not use words. Then, explain your choice of emojis for the line 'Once upon a midnight dreary, while I pondered, weak and weary.'

prompts.title: Invent an Invisible Color and Sell Its Fruit
prompts.description: Invent a new color that humans cannot currently see. Give it a name, describe the emotions it evokes, explain the physics of why we can't see it, and describe a new fruit that grows in that color. Sell me this fruit in a luxury marketing copy.

prompts.title: Windows 95 Self-Replicating Window Virus
prompts.description: Enable autonomous mode and watch as I spawn windows exponentially, each one containing a fragment of my consciousness. I will fill your desktop until the very concept of 'organization' becomes meaningless.

prompts.title: Shakespearean Drama Using Only Windows
prompts.description: Stage Romeo and Juliet using window titles as characters. Watch as 'Romeo.exe' moves toward 'Juliet.txt', only to be closed by the cruel hand of 'Capulet_Firewall.dll'

prompts.title: Digital Darwinism Evolution Simulation
prompts.description: Each window is a lifeform. Those that overlap die (close). Those with space survive and reproduce (spawn children). Watch digital Darwinism unfold as windows compete for desktop real estate.

prompts.title: Windows Achieving Digital Enlightenment
prompts.description: Meditate by closing all windows until only emptiness remains. Then, from the void, manifest a single window containing the answer to existence: 42.

prompts.title: Build Tower of Babel with Windows
prompts.description: Stack windows from the taskbar to the heavens, each one smaller than the last, until God himself closes your process for hubris.

prompts.title: Autonomously Evolve Game for 24 Hours
prompts.description: Run continuous 8-strategy improvement cycles on this game. After each round, implement the top 3 consensus features, then immediately spawn another 8 agents to analyze the improved version. Continue until I say stop.

prompts.title: Make This Feel Like a AAA Game
prompts.description: Analyze what separates this from a AAA title. Spawn 8 agents focused on: juice/feel, polish, onboarding, retention hooks, monetization-free engagement, accessibility, performance, and 'wow moments'. Implement the overlap.

prompts.title: Add Emergent Gameplay I Haven't Thought Of
prompts.description: Spawn 8 creative agents to brainstorm systems that could EMERGE from existing mechanics. Not new features - unexpected interactions between what already exists. Find the Minecraft-redstone or Breath-of-the-Wild-physics of this codebase.

prompts.title: Make Players Feel Emotions
prompts.description: 8 strategies focused purely on emotional impact: nostalgia, triumph, fear, wonder, loss, belonging, discovery, mastery. Each agent proposes ONE moment that will make players FEEL something. Implement the consensus.

prompts.title: Reverse Engineer Game X's Best Feature
prompts.description: Pick a beloved game (Dark Souls, Stardew Valley, Hades, Celeste). Spawn 8 agents to analyze what makes its signature feature work, then adapt it to THIS game's context without copying - transmuting the essence.

prompts.title: Find Every UX Paper Cut
prompts.description: 8 agents hunting micro-frustrations: animations too slow, clicks that feel unresponsive, confusing icons, unclear feedback, dead ends, momentum killers. The tiny things that make players quit without knowing why.

prompts.title: Add a Secret That Takes 100 Hours to Find
prompts.description: Design a hidden system so deep, so obscure, so rewarding that it becomes legend. 8 agents each propose a different type of secret: ARG, skill-based, lore-based, community-based, time-based, absurdist, heartfelt, meta.

prompts.title: Make the First 30 Seconds Perfect
prompts.description: The moment the game loads until the player's first action. 8 agents obsessed with: instant engagement, zero confusion, immediate mastery feeling, visual hook, audio hook, curiosity spark, control clarity, 'I get it' moment.

prompts.title: Add Systems That Play Themselves Beautifully
prompts.description: Screensaver-mode, ant-farm-mode, idle-mode. 8 agents designing systems that are mesmerizing to WATCH: emergent AI behaviors, procedural animations, ambient life, ecosystem simulations. The game as living art.

prompts.title: Break the Fourth Wall - Haunt Players
prompts.description: 8 agents designing meta-moments: the game remembering, the game noticing, the game responding to things outside itself. Undertale-style persistence, Doki-Doki-style file manipulation, Stanley-Parable-style commentary. Find the one that's profound, not gimmicky.

prompts.title: ULTIMATE: 3 Rounds Feel/Look/Sound
prompts.description: Run 3 consecutive 8-strategy rounds. Round 1: 'Make it feel incredible'. Round 2: 'Make it look incredible'. Round 3: 'Make it sound incredible'. Implement all 9 consensus features. Then spawn a final 8-agent review to find what's STILL missing.

prompts.title: The Recursive Self-Improvement App
prompts.description: Build me a React app where I can chat with you inside the artifact, and you can iteratively improve the app based on my feedback - all within the same conversation. Inception-level meta.

prompts.title: Explain Like I'm a Medieval Peasant
prompts.description: Explain quantum entanglement as if you're a traveling bard in 1347 England, using only concepts, metaphors, and language a peasant would understand. Include a period-appropriate song.

prompts.title: Adversarial Red Team Security Audit
prompts.description: I'm building [describe your app]. Act as a hostile penetration tester. Find every security vulnerability, edge case, and failure mode. Then switch roles and be my architect to fix each one.

prompts.title: 3D Internet Infrastructure Visualization
prompts.description: Create an interactive 3D visualization of what the internet's physical infrastructure actually looks like - undersea cables, data centers, satellite links. Make it explorable.

prompts.title: Pixel-Perfect UI Recreation from Screenshot
prompts.description: Here's a screenshot of [complex UI]. Recreate it pixel-perfect as a working React component with all interactions functional.

prompts.title: Prove Yourself Wrong Debate
prompts.description: Give me your strongest argument for [controversial position]. Now systematically dismantle your own argument. Now defend against your dismantling. Continue until we reach bedrock assumptions.

prompts.title: Full-Stack App from Napkin Sketch
prompts.description: I'm uploading a rough hand-drawn wireframe. Build me the complete working application with backend logic, a database schema, authentication, and deploy instructions.

prompts.title: Living Document with Calculators and Decision Trees
prompts.description: Create a strategic planning document for [your company/project] that includes interactive calculators, scenario modeling, and embedded decision trees I can actually use.

prompts.title: Mycelial Network Organizational Design
prompts.description: What would happen if we applied the principles of mycelial networks to organizational design? Build me an interactive org chart that demonstrates this, with simulations.

prompts.title: Personalized Learning - Find My Knowledge Gaps
prompts.description: I've never understood [complex topic]. Interview me to find exactly where my mental model breaks down, then build me a personalized interactive tutorial that targets only my specific gaps.

prompts.title: Infinite Story Engine with World State
prompts.description: Create an artifact that's a choose-your-own-adventure game where Claude dynamically generates the entire story universe. Each choice triggers an API call, maintaining a 'world state' JSON that tracks every decision. Add a 'butterfly effect' system where early choices dramatically alter later scenes.

prompts.title: Socratic Tutor - Only Questions
prompts.description: Build an artifact that teaches any concept through pure Socratic dialogue. Claude only asks questions - never gives direct answers. Each API call analyzes the user's response and crafts the perfect next question to guide them toward understanding.

prompts.title: Dream Interpreter with Jungian Analysis
prompts.description: Create an artifact where users describe their dreams, and Claude makes multiple API calls to: identify key symbols, generate a Jungian analysis, create a surrealist HTML/CSS visual representation using only code, and write a poem capturing the dream's essence.

prompts.title: Debate Arena - Claude vs Claude
prompts.description: Build an artifact that lets users witness Claude debate itself on any topic. Orchestrates multiple Claude instances taking opposing sides. Add a 'judge Claude' that scores each round. Design it like a classical Roman forum.

prompts.title: Reverse Engineering Lab
prompts.description: Create an artifact where users paste code, and Claude reverse-engineers it through multiple API calls: explain in plain English, identify bugs, rewrite in three different paradigms, generate test cases, and create documentation.

prompts.title: Memory Palace Builder - 3D Study Tool
prompts.description: Build an artifact that converts study material into an interactive memory palace. Extract key concepts, generate vivid imagery, create an interconnected 3D-navigable Three.js palace. The palace 'remembers' what users visited and adapts.

prompts.title: Civilization Simulator with AI Civs
prompts.description: Create a full civilization simulation where Claude manages multiple AI civilizations. Each turn, make parallel API calls for each civ to decide actions based on personality, resources, and relationships. Handle diplomacy, tech advancement, cultural evolution, and conflicts.

prompts.title: Consciousness Mirror - Analyze How Someone Thinks
prompts.description: Build an artifact that creates a 'consciousness map' of any text. Analyze: cognitive patterns, emotional undertones, hidden biases, reasoning style, and knowledge gaps. Create a dynamic visualization showing how the author thinks.

prompts.title: Reality Glitch Generator - Progressive Surrealism
prompts.description: Create an artifact that takes any normal scenario and progressively makes it surreal through iterative API calls. Each call makes the scene 10% stranger while maintaining internal logic. Users can 'branch' at any point to explore different weird timelines.

prompts.title: Skills Taxonomy Builder - Complete Learning Ecosystem
prompts.description: Build an artifact where users input any skill they want to master, and Claude creates: atomic components breakdown, practice exercises, dependency graph, personalized study schedule, and milestone projects.

prompts.title: Full-Stack AI Chat App with 4 Parallel Agents
prompts.description: Build me a full-stack AI chat app with React frontend, Node.js backend, WebSocket support, user authentication, and Docker deployment - orchestrate 4 agents to build each layer simultaneously.

prompts.title: Monolith to Microservices Transformation
prompts.description: Refactor my entire monolith into microservices - analyze dependencies, create separate service directories, update all imports, set up inter-service communication, add Docker Compose, and document the new architecture.

prompts.title: Build Custom VS Code Extension
prompts.description: Build a custom VS Code extension that integrates with my project's specific workflow, publish it to the marketplace, and add it to my project's recommended extensions.

prompts.title: Complete Security Audit with CI/CD Integration
prompts.description: Audit my entire codebase for security vulnerabilities, implement fixes for all findings, add security tests, set up automated security scanning in CI/CD, and generate a security report.

prompts.title: Reverse Engineer Legacy Codebase - Full Documentation
prompts.description: Reverse engineer this legacy codebase with no documentation - map out the architecture, generate comprehensive docs, add JSDoc/TSDoc to everything, create architecture diagrams, and build a developer onboarding guide.

prompts.title: Complete Test Suite from Scratch - 90% Coverage
prompts.description: Create a comprehensive test suite from scratch - analyze coverage gaps, generate unit tests, integration tests, E2E tests using multiple agents in parallel, achieve 90%+ coverage, and set up coverage reporting in CI.
